text:
I was recently listening to the Pallet Town theme. Pokemon Blue was my first RPG ever, and now I barely play anything aside from RPGs. Honestly, this just brings back so many memories... My buddies at school pick fun at me 'cause I'm still playing Pokemon, but I don't care. Me playing awesome games like the Final Fantasies, The Elder Scrolls, Mass Effect, KotOR and a lot more... It's all due to Pokemon Blue.
(Nowadays I think Ruby's the best, but I still love Blue more)

text: Red and Blue are where it's at!!!!! One thing i never understood: Okay, you get Red. You beat the game. Your walking around thinking, "Why the fuck can't i get all the pokemon!" You realize, "Dammit, I have to get blue now..." So you save up your allowance for a month trying to get Blue version and another GBC. You beat blue, got all your trading done, and WTF Yellow came out where it has all the pokemon!! I remember getting so mad at myself for goin through all that trouble. Now, I just wait.

author: tsherwoodrzero

text: having aged twelve years and played all the others, i still have the opinion that red and blue had the most heart and soul put into it.  silver was good.  i loved ruby.  fire red and platninum are great, too.  but this... transcends all of them.  not because of game mechanics, but because of the music, the sprites, and the story.  no end of the world crap (r/s/e/d/pr/pl), you're just trying to be the best, while saving animals from evil bastards and putting them in boxes.  oh, the irony.

"First gym battle, here we go! What... Fire is weak against rock?! Fuuuuuck."
(My brother's first experience with, Pokemon Red Version.)
